channel.description: Recent content in music on My News Aggregator

item.title: TV tonight: from Charli xcx to Cat Burns, who will win this year’s Mercury prize?
item.description: The ceremony will be broadcast live from Abbey Road studios. Plus: a throuple seek help in Couples Therapy. Here’s what to watch this evening

item.title: —__–___ – Night of Fire
item.description: —–_

item.title: Nothing But The Truth: Toda la Verdad sobre Dame Area by Dame Area
item.description: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->The Catalan duo’s brutal post-industrial style captures the spirit of the now-legendary club it rose from, writes Skye Butchard

item.title: New Order to Reissue ‘Brotherhood’ in Deluxe Box Set
item.description: <!-- raw HTML omitted --><!-- raw HTML omitted --> The expanded edition of the band’s 1986 album takes in unreleased demos, 12-inch singles and two DVDs

item.title: Moin Reveal New Album for AD 93, ‘You Never End’
item.description: <!-- raw HTML omitted --><!-- raw HTML omitted --> The 11-track release is out next month

item.title: Sade’s First New Song in Six Years to Appear on New Compilation
item.description: <!-- raw HTML omitted --><!-- raw HTML omitted --> ‘Young Lion’ is dedicated to her son, Izaak, and appears on a new release celebrating trans artists and people

item.title: The Body Detail New LP, ‘The Crying Out Of Things’
item.description: <!-- raw HTML omitted --><!-- raw HTML omitted --> It’s out on Thrill Jockey in November

item.title: Pearson Sound Unveils New EP on Hessle Audio, ‘Which Way Is Up’
item.description: <!-- raw HTML omitted --><!-- raw HTML omitted --> The four-tracker is the UK producer’s first EP since 2022

item.title: “Music? Horrible.” David Yow’s Favourite Records
item.description: <!-- raw HTML omitted --><!-- raw HTML omitted --> Although he says he doesn’t listen to music, and that he’s not a musician, The Jesus Lizard’s David Yow nevertheless supplies a heartfelt Baker’s Dozen that ranges from Motörhead to Snoopy’s Christmas

item.title: Love Is The Transcendent Thing: Famous Interviewed
item.description: <!-- raw HTML omitted --><!-- raw HTML omitted --> Laviea Thomas meets Jack Merrett of the ironically-titled Famous to discuss their non-ironic elegies to the power of love. Featuring brand new video ‘What Are You Doing For The Rest Of Your Life?’ All portraits by Jack Lovekin

item.title: Pat Thomas – The Solar Model of Ibn Al-Shatir
item.description: <!-- raw HTML omitted --><!-- raw HTML omitted --> Pat Thomas

item.title: Britain’s first gay anthem? Why the UK’s pioneering LGBTQ+ protest band reunited
item.description: Written by members of the Gay Liberation Front in 1972, A Gay Song is a joyously defiant rallying cry. Artist Ian Giles explains why he persuaded its unruly creators to return to the studio

item.title: ‘Let them kick the crap out of the songs’: how we recreated the Beatles to make Backbeat
item.description: ‘I knew people who said John Lennon was angry, insecure and cruel in the early days. When I met Ian Hart, I saw he could provide that’

item.title: Coco & Clair Clair: Girl review – girlish singsong with sizzle and spark
item.description: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->(Nice Girl World)<!-- raw HTML omitted --><!-- raw HTML omitted -->After years of lightweight pop, the duo are breaking new ground with their second full-length album<!-- raw HTML omitted --><!-- raw HTML omitted --><!-- raw HTML omitted -->

item.title: Orrin Evans and the Captain Black Big Band: Walk a Mile in My Shoe review – perseverance and Philly pride
item.description: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->(Imani Records)<!-- raw HTML omitted --><!-- raw HTML omitted -->Evans’ soulful and communal album explores his health condition with the help of A-list instrumentalists and vocal stars including Bilal and the legendary Lisa Fischer

item.title: ‘I’m intrigued by failure’: Kim Deal on death, addiction – and releasing her debut solo album at 63
item.description: Having weathered the losses of close family members and collaborator Steve Albini – and supported Olivia Rodrigo live at her request – the Breeders and Pixies star finds herself mooting mortality and legacy

item.title: Huw Montague Rendall: Contemplation album review – young opera star justifies the buzz
item.description: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->Montague Rendall/Opéra Orchestre Normandie Rouen/Glassberg<!-- raw HTML omitted -->(Erato)<!-- raw HTML omitted --><!-- raw HTML omitted -->The debut album from the British baritone lives up to the hype, showcasing his velvet and nuanced singing with room to spare

item.title: Jason Schwartzman: ‘I was the kid driving around all the record stores buying all the Oasis singles’
item.description: The actor answers your questions on auditioning for Wes Anderson, his love of Britpop, his telepathic mother and never hearing back from Ringo Starr

item.title: Jon Hopkins: Ritual review | Alexis Petridis’s album of the week
item.description: <!-- raw HTML omitted -->(Domino)<!-- raw HTML omitted --><!-- raw HTML omitted -->Originally written for an installation with mind-altering intentions, the producer’s seventh album is occasionally engaging but dissolves into drift

item.title: Darkness, drama and Daft Punk: the Weeknd’s best songs – ranked!
item.description: Ahead of Abel Tesfaye’s livestreamed concert in Brazil to launch his new era, we rate his path from cult mixtape star to pop icon
